text: Camillo Baldi (died 1650) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Nicotera (1645–1650). (in Latin)"Bishop Camillo Baldi" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved July 15, 2016"Diocese of Nicotera e Tropea" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved March 23, 2016"Diocese of Nicotera" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 14, 2016 ==Biography== On 6 March 1645, Camillo Baldi was appointed during the papacy of Pope Innocent X as Bishop of Nicotera. On 19 March 1645, he was consecrated bishop by Giulio Cesare Sacchetti, Cardinal-Priest of Santa Susanna, with Onorato Onorati, Bishop of Urbania e Sant'Angelo in Vado, and Papirio Silvestri, Bishop of Macerata e Tolentino, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Nicotera until his death in 1650. == References == Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Innocent X Category:1650 deaths
title: Camillo Baldi (bishop)
